description:
Chitinophaga caseinilytica is a species of bacteria that belongs to the phylum Bacteroidetes. It is a Gram-negative, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacterium. Chitinophaga caseinilytica is known for its ability to degrade casein, a protein found in milk and dairy products.

The cells of Chitinophaga caseinilytica are typically rod-shaped and measure approximately 0.3-0.5 μm in width and 1.0-5.0 μm in length. They are motile, possessing gliding motility, which allows them to move across surfaces.

Chitinophaga caseinilytica is found in various environmental sources, such as soil and water, where it plays a role in the degradation of organic matter. Its ability to hydrolyze casein makes it a potentially useful microorganism in the dairy industry, as it may contribute to the ripening and maturation of certain cheese varieties.

The genome of Chitinophaga caseinilytica has been sequenced, providing insights into its metabolic capabilities and adaptations to its ecological niche. Further research on this species may reveal additional applications in biotechnology or its role in various environmental processes.
